CountryData.name: United States Minor Outlying Islands
CountryData.description: The United States Minor Outlying Islands represent a remote and largely uninhabited archipelago stretching across the central Pacific Ocean. Comprising primarily volcanic islands and atolls, these islands offer a unique blend of dramatic landscapes, rich marine biodiversity, and a profound sense of isolation.  They are a vital part of the Pacific ecosystem and hold significant scientific interest due to their geological history and endemic species.

quickFacts.label: Total Area
quickFacts.description: The total land area of the islands.
quickFacts.detail: This encompasses all islands within the system, including those with significant landmass and those primarily consisting of atolls.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.detail: Most residents are involved in fishing, subsistence farming, and tourism.

quickFacts.label: Highest Point
quickFacts.value: Mount Tern on Palmyra Atoll - 1,136 ft (344 m)
quickFacts.description: The highest point in the archipelago.
quickFacts.detail: Palmyra Atoll is the highest point in the system, offering stunning panoramic views.

quickFacts.label: Time Zone
quickFacts.detail: This is 12 hours behind Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

climateData.title: Tropical Climate with Seasonal Variations
climateData.description: The islands experience a tropical climate characterized by consistently warm temperatures and high humidity throughout the year. Rainfall is generally abundant, with distinct wet and dry seasons influenced by prevailing trade winds.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Summer brings the warmest temperatures and heaviest rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn sees a gradual decrease in rainfall and slightly cooler temperatures.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the coolest and driest season, with occasional cold fronts from the north.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a return to warmer temperatures and increasing rainfall.

naturalWonders.name: Palmyra Atoll
naturalWonders.description: Palmyra Atoll is a remarkable example of a raised coral atoll, formed by the subsidence of a volcanic island. It boasts a diverse range of habitats, including pristine beaches, vibrant coral reefs, and lush interior forests.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The atoll’s unique geology and biodiversity have made it a focus of scientific research and conservation efforts. It’s home to numerous endemic bird species and a thriving marine ecosystem.

naturalWonders.name: Gardner Pinnacles
naturalWonders.description: Gardner Pinnacles are a dramatic collection of volcanic stacks rising from the Pacific Ocean, remnants of a submerged volcanic island.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: These towering formations are a popular destination for scuba diving and snorkeling, offering a glimpse into the region’s volcanic past. The surrounding waters are teeming with marine life.

ecosystemData.title: Pacific Island Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: The islands support a diverse range of ecosystems, including coral reefs, tropical forests, and open ocean habitats. These ecosystems are interconnected and play a vital role in the health of the Pacific Ocean.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: The surrounding waters are rich in marine life, including coral reefs, fish, seabirds, and marine mammals.

statistics.details: Including several species of tuna and marlin.

notableSpecies.name: Hawksbill Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A key indicator of reef health.

biodiversityCategories.name: Terrestrial Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: The islands’ interior forests support a variety of plant and animal species, many of which are unique to the region.

statistics.details: Including endemic palm and fig species.

notableSpecies.name: Palmyra Fruit Dove
notableSpecies.significance: A rare and beautiful dove found only on Palmyra Atoll.

notableSpecies.name: Red-tailed Tropicbird
notableSpecies.significance: A majestic seabird known for its aerial displays.
